official_title: To extend emergency crop loss assistance through the 1995 crop year and to remove limitations on receiving such assistance and emergency livestock feed assistance.
short_title: Crop Loss Assistance Extension Act of 1991

summary.text: Crop Loss Assistance Extension Act of 1991 - Amends the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990, and the Agricultural Act of 1949 to: (1) limit combined total assistance under such Acts to any one person for crop loss and livestock feed assistance to $500,000; and (2) increase to $5,000,000 gross income limits for purposes of assistance eligibility. Amends the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to: (1) extend emergency crop loss assistance (including crop insurance coverage) through the 1995 crop year; (2) repeal the $25,000 orchard assistance limitation; and (3) increase to 1000 the number of eligible orchard acres.

titles.title: Crop Loss Assistance Extension Act of 1991
To extend emergency crop loss assistance through the 1995 crop year and to remove limitations on receiving such assistance and emergency livestock feed assistance.
